comment: Dr Denton is great. I made an A in Lab. You have to do the work, if you don't prepare before lab you won't do well. I totally disagree with the other Ratings. He ALWAYS is willing to answer questions & walk around during lab to help. He's not terribly strict with dress code and not a terribly tough grader. I would take him again

I had him for chemlab and he is more than willing to help you if he feels that you are actually trying. even if you dont understand the problem questions try it once or twice and show your work and hell give you atleast some credit. it was a very easy class.

Run. Away. This man is not a teacher, hes a babysitter. Although I'm sure he's great outside of a classroom, he can NOT teach. He hates questions, mostly because he can't answer them. And he doesnt seem like he wants too. Unless you feel comfortable enough with chemistry and feel like you'll fly through the semester easily, dont take him.

This is by far the worst teacher I have ever had. He has no idea what is going on in every lab, and is clueless about everything. DO NOT take this professor. His grading is ridiculous and he explains NOTHING.

Please, if you do not have to take him, dont. He is not a good teacher for the student who is struggling. If you are a chem genius then you'll do okay. but for any normal human being he remains unhelpful. his grading is ABSURD and if he doesnt like you... he'll let you know. hes flat out a rude and terrible professor

Run away from him ASAP. I took him for Chem 1211 and I had a D. I have kept a 3.8 GPA but after I took his class, my GPA dropped drastically. Don't take him unless u want 2 fail. Even if he is the last teacher standing, DON'T do it. For your own sake. PLEASE

If you look above on this page where it says "department", this professor is clearly a business professor. God alone knows who hired him in the Chemistry department. I hope that person reaps that evil deed. he is horrible and I can almost guarantee YOU will fail if u take him for Chemistry. Just sayin!

If you plan on having/keeping a good GPA u better not take this class. Professor Denton is HORRIBLE. Don't say you weren't warned. As soon as he opened his mouth to speak, I fell asleep. He is boring as heck. I tried really hard in this class and still got a D. Barely anyone in the class was making a B. BEWARE, BE WARNED, DON'T FALL A VICTIM!!!

He is horrible.If you want to fail, then this is the class for you.I mean it.Don't plan on making a 4.0 or a good grade if you are taking this class.I took him last fall and he was very unhelpful,oh and he is the most BORING professor I have had.Good heavens!!! You walk into class and are already looking at your watch. Save yourself Dont take him!!

Professor Denton is not a good professor for someone who is not naturally good at Chemistry.  I had such a hard time in this class that I had to withdraw.  Didn't use the textbook much in class and his powerpoint notes corresponded to the wrong edition of textbook anyway.  He wasn't pleasant and was not very helpful when I had questions.

Had Dr Denton for Chem 1211L and he was terrible... stay away!  His prelab lectures were worthless and made several calculation mistakes on the board.. further confusing the class.  Fortunately the class is not that hard if you read the lab manual but if you dont have a clue about chemistry, good luck trying to get anything useful from him

This prof refuses to take responsibility for his inability to teach. 31 students out of 42 failed this last exam, and it's our fault. He tells us that we don't try and need to put in more effort without any reason to suspect we're not except for the grades. He is AWFUL! Why a  business law prof is teaching chemistry is beyond me.

Stay away from this professor. Stay an extra semester if you need to, this guy is not worth it. He is incredibly smart, but can't convey the lessons to students. He is rude when he is asked questions, and either ignores you or makes you feel stupid if you do venture a question. Take anybody else.

It is unfair to say he doesn't care about his students, however, I do agree with alot of you, he seems too smart to come down to general chem level to teach. His slides are someone elses, yet he makes his own test. If you understand whats going on in class you'll do fine. If not GOOD LUCK asking him a question to clarify.

DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS. I loved science and was planning on majoring in Biology until I took his class. I didn't understand anything I dropped the class after about a month. He doesn't know how to teach to students who don't know anything about chemistry. He talks to us like we're geniuses and know what he's talking about. My whole class was lost.

Dr. Denton is too smart of a scientist to actually teach science. He does not know how to clarify chemistry lessons to someone not familiar with chemistry. He uses other professor's slides, then confuses his notes on the board with them. Overall very confusing to learn from. Majority of the class failed the two tests I stayed for. I dropped it.

Denton does not know how to convey information to the students. He does not write his own notes, but rather shows a power point written by someone else. Attendance is not mandatory. Going to class is a waste of time. I had to teach myself the material. It was not only a struggle for me, but for 3/4 of the class, as well.

God forbid anyone ever have to read a text book in college. People who do not do well in this class simply do not put in the effort. I only got an A on one quiz (they're tricky), but was able to exempt final and make an A in the class. Does grade HW pretty strict, but use IRAC (as he stresses DAILY b/c people don't try) and you'll be ok.

To those people who say he is hard, did not do anything in his class. His class is out of 1000 points but due to his structuring its possible to get up to 1300. As long as you follow the format, grading is good. I did learn alot. He is a very understanding professor and will let you make up most missed assignments. Best professor I have had so far.

This is one of those classes that really makes you feel like you're in college. There's loads of material and work. But you learn a lot and at the end it really feels like you accomplished something. Dr. Denton is not the most animated guy but he'll grow on you. Not to mention his resume is more than impressive: He is a former Chief Op. Officer

If you want to work hard, he is a very good professor. Completion is not enough - he challenges students to think in new ways. A lot of writing - more than any class I've ever taken. Extremely helpful & encouraging, you will take a lot from this class.

Gives a lot...i mean A LOT of extra credit. There is a lot of work in the class, but you could do none of it in the beginning and still pass with a high B. I got excused from the final cause I was way over the points needed for an A in the class. Funny teacher. Take him. : )

He is a really good teacher, but it is alot of work. The extra credit can be the difference between an A or C in the class! I recommend holding onto all graded work, because more than a few times the wrong grade was posted on Web CT. He grades tough, but listen to his advice for his homework and you will do well, oh and his quizzes are easy.

He is a very kind and fair teacher! Very approachable. This is a LABOR INTENSIVE class, be prepared to work but he is generous with extra credit and is more than willing to help.  Funny and understanding. If you put the effort in you will do fine and YOU WILL LEARN a lot!  Take him if you like law and are willing to work. Slackers will not do well!
He gives lots and lots of extra credit and he is funny. An A won't come easy, but it is not impossible.

Dr.Denton is a tough teacher. He expects a lot out of his students. When I first took him I was overwhelmed but he lightened up A LOT and gave SO much extra credit. The information is very interesting. He is enlightening and really cares about his students. I put in the effort and got an A in his class. He is not as bad as everyone is saying.

His class is very hard and boring. There is A LOT of work required...there are assignments due EVERY week sometimes even two and they take hours. He grades them hard. The book is your lifesaver cause in class he just rambles w/no notes or central direction. He does offer some extra credit and recently has lessened the amount of homework each week.

OMG this professor is horrible!!! He said he came from UGA and this was his first time teaching here at KSU. This guy passed out the syllabus and began to ramble on about law as though this wasnt the introductory course and you couldn't hear him.  He sounds like Jigsaw off the movie SAW. A MESS! DONT TAKE HIM!!!!
